data.title: depth analysis, research, news and ideas from leading academics and researchers.
data.meta_description: Curated by professional editors, The Conversation offers informed commentary and debate on the issues affecting our world. Plus a Plain English guide to the latest developments and discoveries from the university and research sector.
data.text:
US voters speak many languages, but non-English campaigning remains risky for Harris and Trump

Geoffrey Miller, University of Otago and Miriam Neigert, University of New England

From Aussie politics to Henry Lawson: the story of how ‘Australian studies’ spread across China

Richard Hu, University of Canberra and Diane Hu, The University of Melbourne

‘Not my boy.’ When teachers are harassed by students, some schools and parents fail to help

Samantha Schulz, University of Adelaide and Sarah McDonald, University of South Australia

Islands in the sky: could steep-sided hilltops offer safe haven to our threatened species?

Patrick Finnerty, University of Sydney and Thomas Newsome, University of Sydney
